result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:43 PM 
Defendant Amber Meagan Zwick in court.  Attorney William George Weiland appeared by video for Amber Meagan Zwick.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.
ADA Cassidy calls the case and states appearances.
Court notes that it represented the defendant in a prior case.
Atty Weiland has no issue with the court conducting the case today.
Defendant concurs.
 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant received copy of information.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber Meagan Zwick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

1:25 PM Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Defendant failed to appear at a court appearance yesterday. 
Court questions Defendant regarding non appearance.
Defendant replies.

Court reviews the file.
Court will set for an adjourned initial appearance.
Defendant has not received a copy of the complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.
Warrant is quashed.

2:17 PM Defendant Amber Meagan Zwick not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant fails to appear.

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
ADA Mutchler would request a warrant with a $1,000 cash alternative.
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $1,000 cash alternative
Adjourned Initial Appearance set for 08/01/22 - insufficient address

2:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amber Meagan Zwick in court. 

Defendant did not receive a copy of the criminal complaint.
Complaint is provided to the defendant by Atty Dodge. 
Defendant states she lost her mailbox key and hasn't had it replaced yet.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court informs defendant of constitutional rights and advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Court questions the defendant regarding employment. 
Defendant will see the public defender. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Court questions the defendant regarding her pre-trial supervision program and reporting. 
Defendant responds.

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Atty Soule  does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
